metadata.Title: CVE-2017-16533 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
The usbhid_parse function in drivers/hid/usbhid/hid-core.c in the Linuxkernel before 4.13.8 allows local users to cause a denial of service(out-of-bounds read and system crash) or possibly have unspecified otherimpact via a crafted USB device.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-16533` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-101.124
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-101.124
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-101.124
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1077-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1077.85
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1079-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1079.84
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1041.50
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1034-gke - 4.4.0-1034.34
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1034-gke - 4.4.0-1034.34
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.13.0-1005.7
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.13.0-1002.5
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1010.15
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.13.0-1008-oem - 4.13.0-1008.9
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-101.124').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').

linux-oem package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1008.9').
